#summary The lang attribute specifies the human language of an element and its attributes.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-w3c

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [DivElement <div> element] > *lang attribute*

== Usage ==

== Values ==

[SpecificationHTML5 HTML 5] says, "The `lang` attribute specifies the primary language for the element's contents and for any of the element's attributes that contain text. Its value must be a valid [http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt RFC 3066] language code, or the empty string."

== Elements ==

You can use the `lang` attribute on any element.
